field.txt: J2ME Polish is suite of tools for creating "polished" J2ME applications. Each tool meets a definite need of J2ME developers:

Build-tools with an integrated device-database, a powerful GUI, a remote method invocation (RMI) framework, a serialization framework, support for Java 5 syntax, a localization framework, a game-engine, a logging framework and a collection of utilities.
Find more information about J2ME Polish at www.j2mepolish.org.

You have successfully installed J2ME Polish ${ Version }.
You can find the documentation in the "doc"-folder.
If you have installed the sample applications, you can create your first MIDlet by calling Ant either from the command-line or from within your favorite Java IDE.
For migrating J2ME Polish into existing projects, just copy the file "build.xml" and the folder "resources" from one of the sample applications to your project.
Remove the installation directory for de-installing J2ME Polish.
